page.title: 09FARMING IN GERRICK AREA
page.content:
General problems of livestock farming in this area include :-
Grass staggers in cattle due to magnesium deficiency. Road accidents cause sheep deaths. Ticks cause a lot of trouble to moor sheep. There is very little worrying of sheep by dogs.
MANPOWER. 15 full-time workers. i.e. 1 worker/66.5 acres. 4 farms have family-only labour. 4 farms employ outside labour, some shared with other farms.
MARKETS. Ruswarp and Stokesley marts for general stock sales. Hexham is used for specialist sheep sales. York is used for specialist cattle sales.
